static member Create : VBuffer * int * Nullable<int> * Nullable<int> * bool * bool -> Microsoft.ML.Data.VBufferEditor<'T>
MemberSignature.Usage: Microsoft.ML.Data.VBufferEditor.Create (destination, newLogicalLength, valuesCount, maxValuesCapacity, keepOldOnResize, requireIndicesOnDense)

Docs.param: The destination buffer. Note that the resulting is assumed to take ownership of this passed in object, and so whatever was passed in as this parameter should not be used again, since its underlying buffers are being potentially reused.
The logical length of the new buffer being edited.
The optional number of physical values to be represented in the buffer. The buffer will be dense if is omitted.
The optional number of maximum physical values to represent in the buffer. The buffer won't grow beyond this maximum size.
True means that the old buffer values and indices are preserved, if possible (Array.Resize is called). False means that a new array will be allocated, if necessary.
True means to ensure the Indices buffer is available, even if the buffer will be dense.
Docs.summary: Creates a using 's values and indices buffers.
